typeSystemDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.typesystems.TemporalTypeSystem
typeSystemDescription.description: This type system contains types for representing temporal expressions and values.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.Timex3
typeDescription.description: Represents a text span which can be interpreted as a numeric value which is stored in a feature.

featureDescription.name: tid
featureDescription.description: Non-optional attribute. Each TIMEX3 expression has to be identified by a unique ID number. This is automatically assigned by the annotation tool.

featureDescription.name: kind
featureDescription.description: Non-optional attribute. Each TIMEX3 is assigned one of the following types: DATE, TIME, DURATION, or SET. The format of the value attribute is determined by the type of TIMEX3. For instance, a DURATION must have a value that begins with the letter ’P’ since durations represent a period of time. This will be elaborated on below in the value section. In addition, some optional attributes are used specifically with certain types of temporal expressions.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value attribute details which temporal information is contained in the TIMEX3. This value is given in an extended ISO 8601 format. Examples: T24:00, 2001-01-12TEV, 1984-01-03T12:00, XXXX-12-02,1964-SU, P4M, PT20M

featureDescription.name: temporalFunction
featureDescription.description: Binary attribute which expresses that the value of the temporal expression needs to be determined via evaluation of a temporal function.

featureDescription.name: anchor
featureDescription.description: Optional attribute. It introduces the annotation of the temporal expression to which the TIMEX3 in question is temporally anchored.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.Date
typeDescription.description: The expression describes a calendar time.

featureDescription.name: day
featureDescription.description: The day of the actual date.

featureDescription.name: month
featureDescription.description: The month of the actual date.

featureDescription.name: year
featureDescription.description: The year of the actual date.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.Time
typeDescription.description: The expression refers to a time of the day, even if in a very indefinite way.

featureDescription.name: hour
featureDescription.description: The hour of the actual time.

featureDescription.name: minute
featureDescription.description: The minute of the actual time.

featureDescription.name: second
featureDescription.description: The second of the actual time.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.Duration
typeDescription.description: The expression describes a duration. This value is assigned to explicit durations.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.TemporalSet
typeDescription.description: The expression describes a set of times.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.DocumentDate
typeDescription.description: Annotation representing the date and time presenting the document if available, e.g., the creation time.

featureDescription.name: dayOfWeek
featureDescription.description: Number of the day, e.g., 1 for Monday

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.DayTime
typeDescription.description: Annotation indicating a time of day e.g., 'in the morning'.

featureDescription.name: timeOfDay
featureDescription.description: Number specifying the time of the day.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.TemporalIntervalBeginIndicator
typeDescription.description: Indicator for a possible begin of a temporal interval.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.TemporalIntervalEndIndicator
typeDescription.description: Indicator for a possible end of a temporal interval.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.UnambiguousTimex
typeDescription.description: Helper annotation type pointing to an most likely unambiguous temporal expression. The term '1992' could represent a year, but also a measurement with that value. Other text spans like '1.1.2015' are most likely unambiguous dates, which can be represented by this type.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.temporal.DateInterval
typeDescription.description: The expression describes an interval(or set) of dates defined by the start and end date of an event.

featureDescription.name: startDate
featureDescription.description: The start date of the temporal interval.

featureDescription.name: endDate
featureDescription.description: The end date of the temporal interval.
